author: Noor Amylia Hilda
title: How Rolex Testimonees are making lasting contributions to marine preservation and conservation
text:
How Rolex Testimonees are making lasting contributions to marine preservation and conservation
Over the last half-century, Rolex has been committed to supporting explorers such as Sylvia Earle of Mission Blue and Titouan Bernicot of Coral Gardeners.
By Noor Amylia Hilda /
As the world faces a battering of climate threats, the ocean remains our best ally for now. Playing a crucial role in regulating the global climate with its oxygenating capabilities and as a thermal regulator, the preservation of the ocean and its marine life is of utmost importance for the sake of the planet.
Few people have dedicated their lives to this cause. Sylvia Earle is one such person whose name is synonymous with marine preservation. The marine biologist and Rolex Testimonee since 1982, founded Mission Blue in 2009, a project that identifies particularly significant biodiversity areas called Hope Spots.
Mission Blue‚Äôs efforts go hand in hand with Rolex‚Äôs dedication to excellence, a brand that has accompanied pioneer explorers over the last half-century. As one of the longstanding partners of the Rolex Perpetual Planet Initiative, Rolex supports Mission Blue‚Äôs goal to help protect 30 per cent of the world‚Äôs seas by 2030.
Says Earle, ‚ÄúWe are facing maybe the most important time in human history. We have a choice about the future, armed with technologies that did not exist until, right about now.‚Äù
‚ÄúKnowledge that has been acquired during my lifetime about the ocean, about who we are, where we come from, that perspective about the danger that we are now in, is cause for hope. Never before have we had a better chance to have a perpetual future ourselves with a planet that works in our favour. We are right on the edge of losing that opportunity,‚Äù she adds.
Earle, who has been a pioneer of ocean exploration for over five decades believes there is still hope if action can be taken urgently. ‚ÄúWhen I first began exploring the ocean, the ocean was a much healthier place. Now, about half the coral reefs globally, are gone. In some places, more than 80 to 90 per cent are gone. And 90 per cent of the sharks are gone. But 10 per cent of the sharks and half of the coral reefs are still in pretty good shape. That is cause for hope.‚Äù
Coral reefs make up some of the most crucial lifeforms that protect coastlines and serve as a source of life for many marine life. For Titouan Bernicot, the founder and CEO of Coral Gardeners, and a Rolex Perpetual Planet Initiative partner since 2022, his mission is to save the reefs before permanent damage is done.
Since 2017, Bernicot and Coral Gardeners have planted over 100,000 corals, with 10 nursery sites across French Polynesia and Fiji growing approximately 26,000 new corals for planting. Coral Gardeners also have the largest social media presence of any reef conservation company, with over half a million followers on their Instagram account.
Bernicot states, ‚ÄúNow we need to find solutions. It‚Äôs our generation of hope, of action and we can already see some good results and examples. And we‚Äôre trying to scale up coral gardening restoration all around the world with technological innovation, and we wake up every morning, thinking about what we can do more for the coral reef.‚Äù
With Earle‚Äôs and Bernicot‚Äôs combined efforts, the two initiatives aim to empower local communities to make an impact on their local marine habitats.
He continues, ‚ÄúMission Blue and Coral Gardeners have a lot of similarities. It‚Äôs about action, hope and people, you know, it‚Äôs not just about protecting or restoring the ocean, it‚Äôs about the people. Because we need ocean conservation to become a new lifestyle, we need saving the planet to be something cool, meaningful and fun, people need to be able to, with their hands, participate, we need to bridge the gap between people and the ocean and its conservation.‚Äù
Meanwhile, Earle believes that it all comes down to forging a stronger relationship with nature to ensure a better future for all. ‚ÄúWhat the Coral Gardeners are doing, what Mission Blue is doing, what Rolex is doing, what everyone, everywhere should be doing, is to care for the natural world as if our lives depend on it, because they do.‚Äù

author: Austin Kurisu
title: Gone but not forgotten: "The blank check was cashed with a flag draped casket and a military funeral.‚Äù | News | wjfw.com
text: Gone but not forgotten: "The blank check was cashed with a flag draped casket and a military funeral.‚Äù Austin Kurisu Austin Kurisu Reporter Author email Sep 26, 2024 1 hr ago Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save WASHINGTON D.C. (WJFW)- The Never Forgotten Honor Flight flew from Mosinee to Washington D.C. and back on September 23. On that flight, 94 Korean and Vietnam Veterans from 13 different Wisconsin counties visited multiple different memorials.Mitch Fisher is a Vietnam Era War Veteran that served in the United States Air Force. He has visited Washington D.C. before but every time, he is moved by the experience, and traveling with the Honor Flight brought new memories.‚ÄúThe monuments, the changing of the guard, I don‚Äôt know how many times you can see it but I always feels moved by it, it‚Äôs a tremendous experience,‚Äù said Fisher. ‚ÄúI stand here and that black wall there are names of 58,000 others on there who served about the same time I did.‚Äù Mitch says that when the experience began, nobody had any certainty as to what was to happen during their time in service.‚ÄúNobody had any guarantees when we went in, there were no promises or jobs or first duty assignments, anything like that," said Fisher. "Essentially, we all wrote a blank check that said train us to meet your needs and send us where you will, some were not fortunate, the blank check was cashed with a flag draped casket and a military funeral.‚Äù Mitch says that despite if you are a Veteran or not, visiting the memorials and monuments in D.C. can help to educate people on what the service members experienced.‚ÄúI think each of us understand the pain, the heroism, the anxiety, especially of those who waited at home for their return, if you haven‚Äôt done it come to D.C. and see these thing yourself it‚Äôs important,‚Äù said Fisher.Never Forgotten Honor Flight stories will air 9/24/24 - 9/27/24. Submit story ideas to akurisu@wjfw.com. author: El Dia
title: A Boca se le viene una seguidilla importante
text:
En medio de los problemas de funcionamiento que arrastra desde hace tiempo, a Boca se le vendr√°n duros encuentros entre el campeonato y la Copa Argentina, que pueden llegar a servir de trampol√≠n en caso de conseguir victorias. Sin embargo, tambi√©n lo puede llegar a exponer si los resultados son adversos.
M√°s all√° del partido de ma√±ana a las 19:30 frente a Uni√≥n en La Bombonera, el Xeneize jugar√° un partido clave el mi√©rcoles pr√≥ximo por los 16avos de Copa Argentina. El rival ser√° Atl√©tico Tucum√°n, a partir de las 21:10 en el Estadio √önico Madre de Ciudades de Santiago del Estero. Sin dudas, un choque de gran importancia para el Xeneize, ya que es una de las competencias que buscar√° obtener para jugar la pr√≥xima Copa Libertadores.
Despu√©s deber√° ir a Parque Patricios para jugar con Hurac√°n el domingo 27 a las 18:30, mientras que una semana m√°s tarde recibir√° a Racing en La Bombonera por el cl√°sico. Despu√©s ir√° a Mendoza para visitar a Independiente Rivadavia, mientras que luego volver√° a jugar como local para recibir a Banfield.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Patrick Mahomes' Trainer Leaves Daunting 3-Word Response to Raiders' Troll Job
text:
By Benedetto Vitale ,
2 hours ago The Las Vegas Raiders went viral on Thursday after being spotted with a Kermit the Frog doll dressed as Patrick Mahomes. The doll was reportedly brought to training camp by a fan as they recorded seventh-round rookie Trey Taylor playing with the doll.
Many have already pointed out the obvious that the Raiders have suddenly given Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs some bulletin board material. That is clearly the case now after Patrick Mahomes' trainer, Bobby Stroupe responded to the viral clip with a daunting three-word message . If this is how Mahomes' trainer feels, then we can only imagine how the star quarterback is approaching the video.
"We will remember."
The original video of the Raiders' Kermit Mahomes doll has since been deleted. However, it was on social media long enough for nearly everyone to see and share it. Reports indicate that no players on the team were "passing around" the doll as implied. Instead, Raiders fans simply recorded the rookie safety holding the doll.
Overall this feels like a bad omen for the Raiders. Especially considering Patrick Mahomes and the Chiefs have essentially owned Las Vegas for several years now. Mahomes' career record against the Raiders is currently 10-2 and Kansas City have clinched the AFC West eight consecutive seasons in a row.
With that in mind the Chiefs are aiming to win its third Super Bowl in three seasons. If they can accomplish that feat, then they'll become the first franchise in NFL history to earn a three-peat. So, it'll be interesting to see if Kansas City can pull it off.
Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes (15) signs autographs for fans after training camp at Missouri Western State University. ¬© Denny Medley-USA TODAY Sports
The front office had a solid offseason as they reeled some exciting players to the roster. Marquise "Hollywood" Brown should be a legitimate deep threat for Patrick Mahomes. Additionally, the Chiefs selected speedster Xavier Worthy in the first round of the 2024 NFL Draft. Kansas City's offense will likely remain atop the NFL standings all season long.
There's a chance we see Patrick Mahomes have one of the best years of his career next season with all that fire power. Which would be wildly impressive considering he threw for 4,183 passing yards, 27 touchdowns, and a 67.2 completion percentage last year.
So, giving Mahomes and the Chiefs some bulletin board material might not be the best decision. But the Raiders seem confident heading into the season. There is plenty of talent in Las Vegas but the quarterback situation could hinder their chances.
